channel.title: Rest on YING ZHEN LI
channel.description: Recent content in Rest on YING ZHEN LI

item.title: HTTP Response codes
item.description: 400 Bad Request This response indicates that the request could not be understood by the client due to a malformed request or due to a failure of domain validation (missing data, or an operation that would cause invalid state). 401 Unauthorized This indicates that the request requires user authentication and will include a WWWAuthenticate header containing a challenge applicable to the requested resource. If the user has included the required credentials in the WWW-Authenticate header, then the response should include an error object that may contain relevant diagnostic information.

item.title: OpenAPI Specification
item.description: OpenAPI lets us define RESTful APIs in a standardized manner, and they can be defined without being tied down to any particular programming language or framework being used. Let’s list the general structure of an OpenAPI specification and use it to redefine the Books API described in Chapter 4, The RESTful Web. If we look at the Books API title, we can define the following elements to describe the API:
